description: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
descriptionMD: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
name: Certified Support Professional 10.12
subtitle: macOS Support Essentials 10.12

episodes.description: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don take a look at prerequisites for getting Sierra installed. They will look at the requirements for hardware as well as the platforms that are supported by Sierra.
episodes.title: Getting Prepared

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don walk the viewer through the process of installing Sierra on a Mac supported device. They talk about some of the considerations as well as the various options that are available when installing the operating system.
episodes.title: Installing macOS Sierra

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don dive into the world of recovering the Sierra operating system when failures arise. They discuss some of the common symptoms that might manifest themselves, the options available during the recovery process as well as demonstrating that process.
episodes.title: OS Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take you through the initial setup configuration for a new or recently installed Mac OS system. Here they will explain and demo the 5 basic setup steps which includes migrating existing data, configure networking, configure user accounts, adjust system preferences, and configure software updates.
episodes.title: Initial Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take you through the initial setup configuration for a new or recently installed Mac OS system. Here they will explain and demo the 5 basic setup steps which includes migrating existing data, configure networking, configure user accounts, adjust system preferences, and configure software updates.
episodes.title: Initial Configuration Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take you through the initial setup configuration for a new or recently installed Mac OS system. Here they will explain and demo the 5 basic setup steps which includes migrating existing data, configure networking, configure user accounts, adjust system preferences, and configure software updates.
episodes.title: Initial Configuration Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore User Accounts in Mac OS 10.12. Here you will learn about the types of user accounts that you may need to configure including Administrators, Standard, Managed with Parental Controls, and Sharing Only. They also explore special accounts like the Guest and Root accounts.
episodes.title: Managing User Accounts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore working with multiple user accounts in Mac OS 10.12. Here they demonstrate the Fast User Switching feature and Parental Controls. These allow you to quickly switch users without needing to close running programs and restrict features of the OS respectively.
episodes.title: Multiple User Accounts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don demonstrate a few ways to secure your Mac through user account security. They begin by showing you how to enable a firmware password. Then they configure/reset user passwords. Finally, they explore the Keychain, iCloud, FileVault, and Privacy controls.
episodes.title: User Account Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Don introduced us to the ways macOS handles disks and their associated data. He details the various file systems supported by macOS Sierra, demonstrates how to prepare a drive for use, and walks us through some troubleshooting procedures should the need arise.
episodes.title: File Storage

episodes.description: In this episode, Don introduced us to the ways macOS handles disks and their associated data. He details the various file systems supported by macOS Sierra, demonstrates how to prepare a drive for use, and walks us through some troubleshooting procedures should the need arise.
episodes.title: File Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Don demonstrates encrypting disks using FileVault v2. He also explains how to upgrade from the original FileVault. He ends the episode by discussing how to securely erase files from the hard drive.
episodes.title: Securing Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don introduce us to File Permissions in macOS Sierra.  They show how permissions are set by default and how they follow the UNIX UGO model.  Don also explains the different types of permissions  and how Access Control Lists are different from the UGO permissions found on macOS Sierra.
episodes.title: File Permissions

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don go more in-depth into the File Permissions by showing how to manipulate them from the terminal.  He demonstrates the use of chmod and chown and how to change the access control lists.  Also demonstrated is how the metadata is retained for files on macOS Sierra.
episodes.title: File Permissions Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look at some of the default file permissions for the home folder and the shared folder.  They also discuss and take a look at some of the  options for repairing the permissions and the issues when using permissions with removable drives too.
episodes.title: File Permissions Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don dive into managing files.  Don demonstrates how to create and use aliases.  Also, he discusses how to use and create the underlying UNIX links, like symbolic and hard links.  He also helps to distinguish how the macOS treats the .app and .pkg files.
episodes.title: Managing Files

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look at hidden system folders.  Don shows how to view the hidden system folders and emphasizes some of the places in which the folders appear to be redundant.  This redundancy is really about the scope of what is effected that is File Domains, according to Don. He also takes the time to point out special folders and what their importance is to the OS.
episodes.title: Managing Files Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don show two of the different file types that are important:  Archive Files and File Images.   Archive file type ZIP are natively supported in the OS.  This allows us to combine multiple files into a single file and compress them too.  This is great when operability is needed when moving data between systems running different Operating System.  File Images are also natively supported (dmg) this is great if working between macOS machines.  These files are mountable and seen by the macOS as another disk drive.  Don also talks about and demonstrates how to create them.
episodes.title: File Archives and Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain the function and use of Time Machine as the Mac OS built-in backup solution. Here they will show you how to set up Time Machine to take backups, configuration settings to fine tune with, and restoring in the event of a failure.
episodes.title: Time Machine

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain the function and use of Time Machine as the Mac OS built-in backup solution. Here they will show you how to set up Time Machine to take backups, configuration settings to fine tune with, and restoring in the event of a failure.
episodes.title: Time Machine Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don take a look at installing applications.  They demonstrate how to install application from the App Store and from Non-App Store source.  They also take a look how applications are managed by the Gatekeeper Security and they finish the episode by take a look at using the dashboard (mission control).
episodes.title: Managing Applications

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don dive into the Application Data.  They show where applications are not just a single standalone file but they require additional files to make them function the way users need to them.  Don demonstrates where to find the preference files that help with settings that will allow the user to customize how the product works with the user.  Also He shows the ability lock the files to prevent modifications and lastly how to use the launch services to choose what opens a file instead of allow the OS to choose for us.
episodes.title: Application Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don continue with Application Data.  Here they take look at two built in features to make working with application data easier: The Quick Look and the Auto Save.  These two combined make it much easier to see the available data without having to open the data in a full blown applications with Quick Look.  Also we see how to setup and use the auto save feature as well.
episodes.title: Application Data Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take a look at application support in Mac OS 10.12 Sierra. They start by looking support for Java (both Apple's version and Oracle's version), and then address iCloud as an application framework.
episodes.title: Application Support

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue to explore application support in Mac OS 10.12 Sierra. They pick back up by looking at accessibility and voice features. Here they cover functions like VoiceOver, Dictation, and Speech.
episodes.title: Application Support Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue to explore application support in Mac OS 10.12 Sierra. Here they discuss application improvements in Sierra, application sandboxing, application monitoring, and Diagnostic reporting and logging.
episodes.title: Application Support Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take a dive into network configuration in Mac OS 10.12. They begin by exploring your physical and wireless network connections. Next they introduce you to the protocols and addressing used to create network connections. This includes TCP/IP, IPv4, IPv6, and MAC.
episodes.title: Network Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue looking into network configuration in Mac OS 10.12. Here they cover configuring IPv4 and IPv6 addressing in more depth. They also explain using DHCP, DNS, and other advanced network functions with more detail.
episodes.title: Network Configuration Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue looking into network configuration in Mac OS 10.12. Here they focus on wireless networking, showing you how to enable wifi, connect to wifi networks, common wireless security features, and building an ad-hoc network.
episodes.title: Network Configuration Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don will take a more detailed look into advanced network configurations. Here they will show you how to define network locations which allows you to have multiple network settings on a single adapter based on the location. They also show you how to configure the built-in VPN client.
episodes.title: Advanced Network Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take a look at using iCloud in Mac OS 10.12. Here they will explain what iCloud is and its advantages, which includes features like cloud storage, KeyChain credential synchronization, Back to My Mac, and Find My Mac.
episodes.title: Using iCloud

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don cover Shared Resources in Mac OS 10.12. Watch as they demonstrate using Apple Remote Desktop(ARD) to remotely manage and update Sierra client on the network. They also show how ARD can be used to replace screen sharing for centralized management. Finally, they describe troubleshooting shared resources.
episodes.title: Sharing Resources

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don cover Shared Resources in Mac OS 10.12. Watch as they demonstrate using Apple Remote Desktop(ARD) to remotely manage and update Sierra client on the network. They also show how ARD can be used to replace screen sharing for centralized management. Finally, they describe troubleshooting shared resources.
episodes.title: Sharing Resources Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don cover Shared Resources in Mac OS 10.12. Watch as they demonstrate using Apple Remote Desktop(ARD) to remotely manage and update Sierra client on the network. They also show how ARD can be used to replace screen sharing for centralized management. Finally, they describe troubleshooting shared resources.
episodes.title: Sharing Resouces Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore expanding your Mac's capabilities through peripheral devices. They go over the different types of common peripheral devices like storage, input/output devices, and communications. They also cover driver support for 3rd party devices.
episodes.title: Peripheral Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don look into supporting printers in Mac OS Sierra. They cover topics like connection types, printer drivers, managing the print queue, and sharing print devices with other users.
episodes.title: Supporting Printers

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take on the task of troubleshooting issues with Mac OS Sierra if/when they arise. Here they will explore the process of troubleshooting starting with the boot process through to the loading of the operating system, login, finishing with logout. They also cover system recovery options and "hidden" system shortcuts and diagnostics.
episodes.title: System Troubleshooting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take on the task of troubleshooting issues with Mac OS Sierra if/when they arise. Here they will explore the process of troubleshooting starting with the boot process through to the loading of the operating system, login, finishing with logout. They also cover system recovery options and "hidden" system shortcuts and diagnostics.
episodes.title: System Troubleshooting Part 2
